answers.answer: Hi Candace,I am so sorry you are having such a hard time.  I hope the next few months fly by and you are able to carry this baby until it is safe for her to be born.It's snowing here too.  Where are you?  I am in Nova Scotia.Wishing you and your baby well.

Hi Candace:Isn't it nice to have the Internet now, so you can talk to people all over the place while you are in a position to have stay still all the time?  Thank goodness for small things, right?  We are going to have snow here tonight (Baltimore), too, and I just keep thinking how warm it will be when I deliver at the end of June.  I am 23 wks and 4 days today with my first (a boy who also kicks constantly) - very close to you!  Are you going to have to stay in the hospital for the rest of your pg, or do you get to do bedrest from home soon?  Hopefully you are already there now.  Hopefully where you are, the warm weather will be outside when you are able to get up and about.  I will be thinking of you.  I can imagine how frustrated the process must be.  You are doing all the right things by your little one, though, and hopefully that provides you with some solace.  Is this your first?  Please keep in touch and TAKE CARE!

hey ladies!  thanks for the responses!!  i'm in wisconsin, so the weather is cold and snowy.  luckily, since i've been home, it hasn't been too bad.  after the first 2 days of the hospital, it looked like i was going to have to spend the rest of the pregnancy there.  but luckily, my blood pressure stableized and was able to come home after almost a week.  i'm also thankfull that it is winter and the weather is crummy - it's making staying in bed a little easier.  i don't know what i would do if it was warm and sunny out!  i learned to crochet, so i'm working on a blanket for her.... it's keeping me busy for sure.  she's due to come june 18th, but my ob is looking more at early june.  it can't come quick enough!!!!  is there somewhere we can go to exchange email addy's?  it'd be nice to have a penpal.Blessings,Candace
***@****I don't get on too often, but I'll check it out if I know something could be there!
I will try to post mine here:  hope it doesn't get deleted:***@*******@****
thanks ladies!  when i write you, i'll put bedrest penpal in the object line so you know it's not junk.  yay!

question: hey ladies! sorry it's been awhile, but i've been put on complete bedrest.  i developed preeclampsia.  i knew i'd get it because my mom had it with all 4 of us, but i didn't think i'd get it at 24 weeks.  turns out to i have a kidney disease called thin membrane disease.  so, i have super excessive protein leakage, which is not good.  my ob said she wants to keep me pregnant as long as possible, at least 30 weeks and probably no later than 37 weeks.  i'm hoping for the later!  i spent the last week in the hospital which was horrible because we got a ton of snow here, so i had no visitors cuz no one wanted to drive in it.  which, i don't blame them!  i never knew daytime tv was so bad!  lol  anyhow, after all the monitoring, they decided that with bedrest, i can be stableized.  the baby is doing awesome also.  she's kicking so hard and is so active.... to active the nurses say, lol.  when they would put the monitor on, sometimes it would take in upwards of 20 minutes to find her heartbeat because she'd be moving all over.  then, when they did find it, they nurse would have to hold the monitor there for 20 minutes.  after the first night, they nicknamed her "little stinker".  an active baby is a healthy baby.... so horray!  i go for the dreaded glucose test next week.  great.  i'm kinda expecting to have gestational diabetes just because what could go wrong has gone wrong, ya know?  but i'm really really really praying that i won't have it.  i definately don't need the added stress.hope all is well with you ladies!Blessings,Candace
title: bedrest - uggggh!
